intro: Scrophularia peregrina, commonly known as the wandering jew, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture and produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Scrophularia peregrina is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats, showcasing its adaptability to various environments.
